modules.description: Provides functions to manage persistent sessions, including loading, saving, editing, and deleting sessions by name. Supports recording and stepping through session steps, with operations that interact with files and user input. Used to store and retrieve sequences of OCaml expressions for interactive development and debugging.

Provides functions to edit and clear a history log, operating on a persistent in-memory record of events. Edits the history using an external text editor, while clearing removes all stored entries. Used to maintain and manipulate command or action history during interactive sessions.

Handles interactive input processing with a custom reader function, executes OCaml source files, and evaluates input without output. Operates with strings, bytes, and top-level input structures. Used for embedding OCaml in applications, scripting, and controlled evaluation environments.

Provides line editing, command history, session persistence, and interactive identifier completion with documentation. Works with the OCaml toplevel environment and leverages ocp-index for metadata. Enhances REPL usability by enabling seamless navigation and exploration of code structures.

Manages interactive OCaml sessions with persistent storage, history tracking, and input processing. Supports loading, saving, and navigating session steps, editing and clearing command histories, and evaluating OCaml code from files or strings. Operations include file I/O, user interaction, and controlled execution environments. Users can replay sessions, modify history, and embed OCaml in applications with fine-grained input control.
